page.title: 10Waverton Church Customs
page.content: There has been a church in Waverton for about 900 years.One of the most popular church customs is the{Rogation {Walk}when we ask for God's blessing on the fields. We start at the churchyard by singing a hymn and saying prayers. We walk around the village,stopping at focal points to sing.To reach points in the parish which are far apart we travel in a hired bus.The children's favourite stop is at Lord Woolley's farm where we have drinks,sandwiches cakes, and ice lollies. The children play on the hay bales. Another popular custom is{Plough Sunday}when a calf and plough are brought into church for the Rector to bless.On{Remembrance {Sunday}all the village organisations come to church including members of the Evangelical church and the Methodists.At the end of the service we gather around the War Memorial.
